intro: Trichonema caulescens, commonly known as the slender-stemmed liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a leafy stem and is characterized by its simple, non-vascular anatomy. It produces spores in capsules that are borne on short, stalked shoots called sporophytes. Trichonema caulescens plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
